Here's what I found about Dan Koe's newsletter, Modern Mastery, and his writing techniques:

## Dan Koe's Newsletter & Modern Mastery

Dan Koe publishes "The Koe Letter," where he writes content that falls within 2 categories: 1) Too long and philosophical, and 2) Too short and out of context. In The Koe Letter, he distills his top 3 life and business insights of the week, keeping it understandable, impactful, and actionable.(no content)Modern Mastery is a private community for all things marketing, sales, personal development, and performance. Members get instant access to a strategy library, personalized help in the Discord, and more. Readers can join for $5.(no content)Dan Koe's Modern Mastery is an online paid course and community. MMHQ prepares their members to make a name for themselves and monetize their skills. Members can grow their social media presence, share their knowledge, or offer services for their one-person businesses.

## Dan Koe's Writing Techniques

Dan Koe starts most of his articles, newsletters, videos, and threads with a personal experience to help illustrate the problem and relate to the readers. People want to feel understood. If they feel understood, they are more open to hearing what you have to say.(no content)He emphasizes that "good writing is about piecing together everything you have available to you."(no content)On storytelling: "Storytelling is NOT always a story." Stories consist of anecdotes, research, examples, metaphors, quotes, tweets, videos, other content, and anything else you can do to help someone else understand.(no content)Key writing advice: Have some conviction behind what you are saying. It's just a matter of writing the words in the most impactful way. Leaders don't dance around the point they are trying to get across.(no content)On voice: Active voice implies that there is a story and eases people into what you are saying. Passive voice is often boring and gives away the "mini-story" too early.(no content)On content repurposing: Lists with multiple bullet points can be turned into their own content. These lists can also be turned into the outline of a thread, carousel, or newsletter.(no content)His content strategy involves copying, pasting, and recording content he's already written in his newsletters, threads, and tweets. He suggests mastering Twitter first, gaining some authority, then using your best tweets to break into new platforms since those ideas are already validated to do well.

Here's what I found about Dan Koe's Twitter/X posts and writing style:

## Dan Koe's Twitter Profile

Dan Koe (@thedankoe) has 740.1K followers on X. His bio describes his posts as "notes to myself" and he is building @edendotso as a writer.

## Examples of His Post Style

**Repetition/Anaphora Style:**
One of his popular posts reads: "Go on more walks. Walk for no reason. Walk to solve a problem. Walk to blow off steam. Walk to get outside. Walk to listen, read, and learn. Walk to escape distractions. Walk to improve your health. Walk to think. A simple walking habit can change absolutely everything."

**"Starting from Zero" Thread Style:**
Another example: "If I was starting from zero, here's what I would do: 1) Start on social media... social media is the new media - media is where the attention is - media is how you attract people to your independent work - anyone can become a one-person media company... And no, it's not even close to saturated."

## Key Style Elements (Analysis)

His Twitter strategy includes: consistent focus on personal development themes, balance of motivation and practical advice, strong use of pattern interruption, clear direct communication style, mix of standalone insights and detailed threads, emphasis on action over theory, and regular challenging of societal norms.

## Lessons from His Approach

Dan Koe has built an audience of 500,000+ across multiple platforms, and it all started on Twitter. He has used his writing to build a $500K+ year one-person business.

Key strategies include:
- **Being "spiky"**: Spiky opinions make you stand out from the crowd on Twitter. While everyone is posting the same old boring platitudes, publish something that piques interest and forces conversation.
- **Visualizing ideas**: Simple visuals do really well on Twitter. Take the concept you're about to write a thread about, and turn it into a catchy visual.
- **Impactful hooks**: A hook is the heart of a thread. You should spend as much time on the hook as you do on the rest of the thread.

## His Content Philosophy

According to Dan Koe, "The 3 pillars of social leverage are growth, authenticity, and authority. Your content, on a 1-2 month timescale, should hit each of these."(no content)He believes tweets are the perfect length and structure for high-performing posts on any platform. His LinkedIn posts, Instagram posts and reels, TikToks, and the rest are all based off of his tweets.(no content)Dan has shared that he values platforms that prioritize short-form constrained writing, stating it "made me a clear, concise, and impactful thinker."

Here's what I found about Dan Koe's writing style and content strategy for 2025-2026:

## Dan Koe's Content Strategy

### Core Approach
Dan Koe's newsletter, The Koe Letter, is the cornerstone of his entire content system.(no content)Once a week, Koe sends out an in-depth publication to over 175,000 subscribers on how to turn your passion into profit, with a focus on business, philosophy, and leveraging his newsletter as the foundation for his content flywheel.

### Newsletter-First Repurposing System
"Nothing is easier than writing a newsletter and then looking back at the newsletter and easily, inside of it, seeing 5-7 pieces of content." Dan Koe says: "When I focus on writing my newsletter for 30 minutes every morning, all of my other content is handled. It's as simple as deconstructing the newsletter and repurposing it everywhere in less than 10 minutes a day."

### Writing Philosophy
The problem most people have with short-form writing is they don't want to be shallow. They get upset when people don't follow or engage with the ideas they post. Koe advises: "Stop thinking about it like that. Think of it like you are expanding people's minds from shallow to deep. How are you going to help people if you expect them to know everything you know?"

### Long-Form vs Short-Form
Koe argues that long form is still on top. He explained, "A lot of people focus on short form nowadays, but you don't have what I call 'time under attention.' If people watch a week's worth of reels from you, you've maybe held five to seven minutes of their attention."

### AI-Assisted Writing
Dan Koe himself said he uses AI to assist his writing by having AI interview him, extracting ideas, and then formatting them into a high-virality content structure.

### Viral Success
An article by Dan Koe titled "How to fix your entire life in 1 day" garnered over 150 million views on platform X. However, his primary income (over $4 million in 2024) comes from backend paid subscriptions, book sales, and AI tool sales, not platform revenue sharing.

### His Writing Style's Impact
Various AI skill tutorials and inspirational articles are emerging, like "How to change your life in 2026," "The one skill you need," "Why most people will never succeed"... The structure is the same, the image style is the same as Dan's viral post, even the "I'm here to tell you the truth" tone is the same. This writing style has even become a meme.

### 2026 Content Trends
Write with an energy signature that is yours, and no one or even AI can write what you just wrote. 2026 is a good year to start producing your own signal for your audience to know what you are and stand for. This has a lot to do with psychological mindset, which is why there's a lot of content towards philosophy and the way of thinking through something with a framework.

input.prompt: Extract Dan Koe's specific writing techniques, frameworks, and examples. Focus on: 1) Hook writing 2) Story structure 3) Authenticity markers 4) Content formats
Extract Dan Koe's Twitter writing templates, post structures, hook examples, and key writing patterns

content.content:
# Dan Koe's Twitter Writing Strategy

## Core Writing Patterns

**Hook Techniques:**
- Pattern recognition openings: "One pattern I've noticed..."
- Personal observations: "The best periods of my life..."
- Paradoxes and contrasts
- Reality checks framed as wake-up calls

## Post Structure Elements

**Effective Formats:**
- "Short, punchy statements perform well consistently"
- Thread starters with promises of valuable information
- Lists and bullet points for complex ideas
- Problem-solution format with clear actionable steps

## Linguistic Signature

**Frequently Used Vocabulary:**
- Action words: build, start, create, learn
- Empowerment terms: potential, discipline, clarity
- "Direct and authoritative" tone blended with motivational messaging
- Challenge-oriented language: uncomfortable, difficult, hard

## Engagement-Driving Elements

**High-Performance Content Types:**
- Image-based posts about routines (highest bookmarks)
- Threads consistently outperform single posts
- "Contrarian viewpoints that challenge conventional wisdom generate high engagement"
- Universal truths and actionable advice (more saves)

## Key Success Formula

Focus on personal development themes with a balance of motivation and practical advice. Emphasize action over theory, challenge societal norms, and maintain authentic, direct communication prioritizing mental clarity and purpose.

content.content:
# Dan Koe's Writing Techniques & Frameworks

## 1) Hook Writing

Koe emphasizes grabbing attention immediately. His formula includes:

**Structure:** "hook > body > conclusion"

**Example hook:** "Your content sucks because you don't:" followed by the problem breakdown.

The strategy focuses on making readers stop scrolling by presenting a relatable problem or counterintuitive statement upfront, rather than burying the value proposition.

## 2) Story Structure

Content should follow a progression:
- **Establish importance** by explaining why a topic matters to the audience
- **Build relatability** through personal experience and shared problems
- **Deliver solutions** with actionable, beginner-friendly steps

Koe demonstrates this through his "Importance of a Topic" framework, where creators teach audiences *why* something matters before diving into specifics.

## 3) Authenticity Markers

Key elements include:
- **Personal credibility** ("I started as a creator 3 years ago")
- **Non-monetary interests** interwoven with professional content
- **Philosophy and self-awareness** that humanizes the creator
- **Transparency about process** rather than polished perfection

The core principle: "People want to follow humans" not "a search engine with a face."

## 4) Content Formats

**Primary structure:** List-based tweets adaptable across platforms

**Three authoritative content types:**
1. Actionable principles (step-by-step guidance)
2. Topic importance explanations (why it matters)
3. Mistake callouts (establishing expertise through pattern recognition)

All formats emphasize **shareability over specificity** for growth-stage creators.

toolUseResult.result:
# Dan Koe's Writing Techniques & Frameworks

## 1) Hook Writing

Koe emphasizes grabbing attention immediately. His formula includes:

**Structure:** "hook > body > conclusion"

**Example hook:** "Your content sucks because you don't:" followed by the problem breakdown.

The strategy focuses on making readers stop scrolling by presenting a relatable problem or counterintuitive statement upfront, rather than burying the value proposition.

## 2) Story Structure

Content should follow a progression:
- **Establish importance** by explaining why a topic matters to the audience
- **Build relatability** through personal experience and shared problems
- **Deliver solutions** with actionable, beginner-friendly steps

Koe demonstrates this through his "Importance of a Topic" framework, where creators teach audiences *why* something matters before diving into specifics.

## 3) Authenticity Markers

Key elements include:
- **Personal credibility** ("I started as a creator 3 years ago")
- **Non-monetary interests** interwoven with professional content
- **Philosophy and self-awareness** that humanizes the creator
- **Transparency about process** rather than polished perfection

The core principle: "People want to follow humans" not "a search engine with a face."

## 4) Content Formats

**Primary structure:** List-based tweets adaptable across platforms

**Three authoritative content types:**
1. Actionable principles (step-by-step guidance)
2. Topic importance explanations (why it matters)
3. Mistake callouts (establishing expertise through pattern recognition)

All formats emphasize **shareability over specificity** for growth-stage creators.

## Dan Koe Viral Post Examples

### Motivational/Life Advice Posts

One of his popular posts states: "Nobody is coming to save you. Not your friends. Not your family. Not the government. They can offer advice and tools. But at the end of the day, it's up to you to change your mind and act regardless of how you feel."(no content)Another viral post describes a typical unfulfilling day: "Wake up. Hit snooze 4 times. Stare at your phone. Roll out of bed. Make coffee. Sit in traffic. 8 hours of unfulfilling work. Sit in traffic... again. Argue with your 'significant' other. Walk the pet. Watch TV. Pass out. Repeat. This should scare the shit out of you."

### Self-Discipline Content

He defines self-discipline as: "Self-discipline is when the desire to become the highest version of yourself outweighs the desire for cheap pleasures."(no content)"You don't magically become focused. You practice it. You notice you're distracted and snap out of it immediately, over and over again until it's second nature. Most people have not trained this muscle, and they are not anywhere close to as focused as they think they are."

### Content Strategy

Dan Koe has built an audience of 500,000+ across multiple platforms, and it all started on Twitter. He has used his writing to build a $500K+ year one-person business.(no content)His strategy includes being "spiky" - "Spiky opinions make you stand out from the crowd on Twitter. While everyone is posting the same old boring platitudes, publish something that piques interest and forces conversation."

lines: +> "Self-discipline is when the desire to become the highest version of yourself outweighs the desire for cheap pleasures."
+> "You don't magically become focused. You practice it. You notice you're distracted and snap out of it immediately, over and over again until it's second nature."
+> "Those who succeed don't think they are 'disciplined.' They just can't help but do what they do."

+> "Nobody is coming to save you. Not your friends. Not your family. Not the government. They can offer advice and tools. But at the end of the day, it's up to you to change your mind and act regardless of how you feel."

+> "The problem most people have is they don't want to be shallow. They get upset when people don't engage with their ideas. Stop thinking about it like that. Think of it like you are expanding people's minds from shallow to deep."

+> "Wake up. Hit snooze 4 times. Stare at your phone. Roll out of bed. Make coffee. Sit in traffic. 8 hours of unfulfilling work. Sit in traffic... again. Argue with your 'significant' other. Walk the pet. Watch TV. Pass out. Repeat. This should scare the shit out of you."

+> "Go on more walks. Walk for no reason. Walk to solve a problem. Walk to blow off steam. Walk to get outside. Walk to listen, read, and learn. Walk to escape distractions. Walk to improve your health. Walk to think. A simple walking habit can change absolutely everything."

   403â†’# services/vibe/extractor.py
   404â†’
   405â†’class VibeExtractor:
   406â†’    """
   407â†’    é…ç½®é©±åŠ¨ + LLM æ‰§è¡Œçš„ Vibe æå–å¼•æ“Ž

   432â†’        """
   433â†’        ç»Ÿä¸€æ‰§è¡Œå…¥å£
   434â†’
   435â†’        Args:
   436â†’            user_id: ç”¨æˆ· ID

   442â†’        """
   443â†’        # 1. æ‰¾åˆ°åŒ¹é…çš„ extractors
   444â†’        extractors = self._match_extractors(trigger)
   445â†’
   446â†’        results = {}

   449â†’            input_data = await self._collect_input(user_id, extractor_config, context)

   464â†’    def _build_prompt(self, extractor_config: dict, input_data: dict) -> str:
   465â†’        """
   466â†’        æž„å»º LLM Prompt
   467â†’
   468â†’        Prompt ç»“æž„ï¼š
   469â†’        1. é…ç½®è§„åˆ™ï¼ˆschema + merge_rules + transform ç­‰ï¼‰
   470â†’        2. è¾“å…¥æ•°æ®
   471â†’        3. æ‰§è¡ŒæŒ‡ä»¤
   472â†’        """
   473â†’        prompt_parts = []
   474â†’
   475â†’        # 1. Schema å®šä¹‰
   476â†’        prompt_parts.append("## Schema å®šä¹‰")
   477â†’        prompt_parts.append(json.dumps(self.config["schema"], ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))
   478â†’
   479â†’        # 2. æå–è§„åˆ™
   480â†’        prompt_parts.append("\n## æå–è§„åˆ™")
   481â†’        prompt_parts.append(json.dumps(extractor_config, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))
   482â†’
   483â†’        # 3. è¾“å…¥æ•°æ®
   484â†’        prompt_parts.append("\n## è¾“å…¥æ•°æ®")
   485â†’        prompt_parts.append(json.dumps(input_data, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))
   486â†’
   487â†’        # 4. æ‰§è¡ŒæŒ‡ä»¤
   488â†’        prompt_parts.append("\n## æ‰§è¡ŒæŒ‡ä»¤")
   489â†’        prompt_parts.append(extractor_config.get("instruction", "æ ¹æ®è§„åˆ™æå–ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œè¾“å‡º JSONã€‚"))
   490â†’
   491â†’        # 5. è¾“å‡ºè¦æ±‚
   492â†’        prompt_parts.append("\n## è¾“å‡ºè¦æ±‚")
   493â†’        prompt_parts.append("åªè¾“å‡º JSONï¼Œä¸è¦å…¶ä»–å†…å®¹ã€‚ç¡®ä¿ç¬¦åˆ Schema å®šä¹‰ã€‚")
   494â†’
   495â†’        return "\n".join(prompt_parts)

   497â†’    async def _call_llm(self, prompt: str) -> dict:
   498â†’        """è°ƒç”¨ LLM å¹¶è§£æž JSON è¾“å‡º"""
   499â†’        response = await chat(
   500â†’            messages=[{"role": "user", "content": prompt}],
   501â†’            system="ä½ æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªç²¾ç¡®çš„æ•°æ®æå–å’Œè½¬æ¢å¼•æ“Žã€‚æ ¹æ®é…ç½®è§„åˆ™å¤„ç†æ•°æ®ï¼Œè¾“å‡ºç»“æž„åŒ– JSONã€‚",
   502â†’            capability="analysis",

   504â†’        )
   505â†’
   506â†’        # è§£æž JSON
   507â†’        content = response.content if hasattr(response, 'content') else str(response)

   509â†’        if json_match:
   510â†’            return json.loads(json_match.group())
   511â†’        return {}

# Dan Koe å†™ä½œ DNA

> æ·±åˆ»ä½†ä¸æ™¦æ¶©ï¼ŒçŠ€åˆ©ä½†ä¸åˆ»è–„ï¼Œæœ‰å“²å­¦æ·±åº¦ä½†æŽ¥åœ°æ°”

## Dan Koe åŽŸæ±åŽŸå‘³è¯­å½•åº“

### å…³äºŽè‡ªå¾‹ä¸Žè¡ŒåŠ¨

> "Self-discipline is when the desire to become the highest version of yourself outweighs the desire for cheap pleasures."
>
> *è‡ªå¾‹æ˜¯å½“æˆä¸ºæ›´å¥½è‡ªå·±çš„æ¸´æœ›ï¼ŒåŽ‹è¿‡äº†å»‰ä»·å¿«ä¹çš„è¯±æƒ‘*

> "You don't magically become focused. You practice it. You notice you're distracted and snap out of it immediately, over and over again until it's second nature."
>
> *ä¸“æ³¨ä¸ä¼šå‡­ç©ºå‡ºçŽ°ã€‚ä½ å¾—ç»ƒã€‚å‘çŽ°åˆ†å¿ƒï¼Œç«‹åˆ»æ‹‰å›žæ¥ã€‚ä¸€æ¬¡åˆä¸€æ¬¡ï¼Œç›´åˆ°å®ƒæˆä¸ºæœ¬èƒ½*

> "Those who succeed don't think they are 'disciplined.' They just can't help but do what they do."
>

   258â†’def parse_frontmatter(text: str) -> tuple[Dict, str]:
   259â†’    """è§£æž YAML frontmatterï¼ˆæ”¯æŒåµŒå¥—å¯¹è±¡ï¼‰"""
   260â†’    pattern = r'^---\s*\n(.*?)\n---\s*\n(.*)$'
   261â†’    match = re.match(pattern, text, re.DOTALL)
   262â†’    if not match:
   263â†’        return {}, text
   264â†’
   265â†’    frontmatter_str, content = match.groups()
   266â†’
   267â†’    # ä½¿ç”¨ YAML è§£æžä»¥æ”¯æŒåµŒå¥—å¯¹è±¡
   268â†’    try:
   269â†’        metadata = yaml.safe_load(frontmatter_str) or {}
   270â†’    except yaml.YAMLError as e:
   271â†’        logger.warning(f"YAML parse error in frontmatter: {e}, falling back to simple parse")
   272â†’        # å›žé€€åˆ°ç®€å•è§£æž
   273â†’        metadata = {}
   274â†’        current_key = None
   275â†’        current_list = None
   276â†’
   277â†’        for line in frontmatter_str.strip().split('\n'):
   278â†’            stripped = line.strip()
   279â†’            if not stripped:
   280â†’                continue
   281â†’            if stripped.startswith('- ') and current_key:
   282â†’                if current_list is None:
   283â†’                    current_list = []
   284â†’                current_list.append(stripped[2:].strip())
   285â†’                metadata[current_key] = current_list
   286â†’            elif ':' in line and not line.startswith(' '):
   287â†’                current_list = None
   288â†’                key, value = line.split(':', 1)
   289â†’                current_key = key.strip()
   290â†’                value = value.strip()
   291â†’                if value in ('|', ''):
   292â†’                    continue
   293â†’                elif value.lower() == 'true':
   294â†’                    metadata[current_key] = True
   295â†’                elif value.lower() == 'false':
   296â†’                    metadata[current_key] = False
   297â†’                else:
   298â†’                    metadata[current_key] = value
   299â†’
   300â†’    return metadata, content.strip()
   301â†’
   302â†’
   303â†’def parse_skill_md(text: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   304â†’    """è§£æž SKILL.md å†…å®¹ï¼Œæå–ç»“æž„åŒ–ä¿¡æ¯
   305â†’
   306â†’    æ”¯æŒä¸¤ç§è§¦å‘è¯æ ¼å¼ï¼š
   307â†’    1. æ—§æ ¼å¼ï¼šfrontmatter ä¸­çš„ triggers: åˆ—è¡¨
   308â†’    2. æ–°æ ¼å¼ï¼šdescription ä¸­çš„ "è§¦å‘è¯ï¼šxxxã€xxxã€xxx"
   309â†’    """
   310â†’    metadata, content = parse_frontmatter(text)
   311â†’
   312â†’    # ä»Ž frontmatter èŽ·å–è§¦å‘è¯ï¼ˆæ—§æ ¼å¼ï¼‰
   313â†’    triggers = metadata.get("triggers", [])
   314â†’
   315â†’    # å¦‚æžœ frontmatter æ²¡æœ‰ triggersï¼Œå°è¯•ä»Ž description ä¸­æå–ï¼ˆæ–°æ ¼å¼ï¼‰
   316â†’    if not triggers:
   317â†’        description = metadata.get("description", "")
   318â†’        # åŒ¹é… "è§¦å‘è¯ï¼šxxxã€xxxã€xxx" æˆ– "è§¦å‘è¯:xxx,xxx,xxx"
   319â†’        trigger_match = re.search(r'è§¦å‘è¯[ï¼š:]\s*([^ã€‚.]+)', description)
   320â†’        if trigger_match:
   321â†’            trigger_str = trigger_match.group(1)
   322â†’            # æ”¯æŒé¡¿å·ã€é€—å·åˆ†éš”
   323â†’            triggers = [t.strip() for t in re.split(r'[ã€,ï¼Œ]', trigger_str) if t.strip()]
   324â†’
   325â†’    result = {
   326â†’        "id": metadata.get("id", ""),
   327â†’        "name": metadata.get("name", ""),
   328â†’        "description": metadata.get("description", ""),
   329â†’        "triggers": triggers,
   330â†’        "default_scenario": metadata.get("default_scenario", "basic_reading"),
   331â†’        "global_tools": metadata.get("global_tools", []),  # ä»Ž frontmatter è¯»å–
   332â†’        # v7.1: SOP é…ç½®é©±åŠ¨
   333â†’        "requires_birth_info": metadata.get("requires_birth_info", False),
   334â†’        "requires_compute": metadata.get("requires_compute", False),
   335â†’        "compute_type": metadata.get("compute_type", None),
   336â†’        "compute_tool": metadata.get("compute_tool", None),
   337â†’        "collect_tool": metadata.get("collect_tool", None),
   338â†’        "external_tools": metadata.get("external_tools", []),  # v7.3
   339â†’        # v2.2: Profile æ³¨å…¥é…ç½®
   340â†’        "requires_skill_data": metadata.get("requires_skill_data", []),
   341â†’    }
   342â†’
   343â†’    # æå–ä¸“å®¶èº«ä»½
   344â†’    expert_match = re.search(r'## ä¸“å®¶èº«ä»½\s*\n(.*?)(?=\n## |\Z)', content, re.DOTALL)
   345â†’    result["expert_persona"] = expert_match.group(1).strip() if expert_match else ""
   346â†’
   347â†’    # æå–åœºæ™¯ç›®å½•
   348â†’    scenarios = {"entry": [], "standard": [], "professional": []}
   349â†’    for level in scenarios.keys():
   350â†’        pattern = rf'### {level.capitalize()}.*?\n\|.*?\n\|.*?\n((?:\|.*?\n)*)'
   351â†’        match = re.search(pattern, content, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL)
   352â†’        if match:
   353â†’            for row in match.group(1).strip().split('\n'):
   354â†’                cols = [c.strip() for c in row.split('|')[1:-1]]
   355â†’                if len(cols) >= 2:
   356â†’                    scenarios[level].append(cols[1])  # æ–‡ä»¶å
   357â†’    result["scenarios"] = scenarios
   358â†’
   359â†’    # æå–ä¼¦ç†è¾¹ç•Œ
   360â†’    ethics = {"forbidden": [], "sensitive": [], "principles": []}
   361â†’    forbidden_match = re.search(r'### ç»å¯¹ç¦æ­¢\s*\n((?:- .*?\n)*)', content)

   379â†’def parse_scenario_md(text: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   380â†’    """è§£æž scenario.md å†…å®¹"""
   381â†’    metadata, content = parse_frontmatter(text)
   382â†’
   383â†’    result = {
   384â†’        "id": metadata.get("id", ""),

   391â†’    # æå–è§¦å‘æ¡ä»¶
   392â†’    triggers = {"primary": [], "secondary": []}
   393â†’    primary_match = re.search(r'\*\*ä¸»è¦è§¦å‘è¯\*\*:\s*(.*?)(?:\n|$)', content)
   394â†’    if primary_match:
   395â†’        triggers["primary"] = [t.strip() for t in primary_match.group(1).split(',')]
   396â†’    secondary_match = re.search(r'\*\*æ¬¡è¦è§¦å‘è¯\*\*:\s*(.*?)(?:\n|$)', content)
   397â†’    if secondary_match:
   398â†’        triggers["secondary"] = [t.strip() for t in secondary_match.group(1).split(',')]
   399â†’    result["triggers"] = triggers
   400â†’
   401â†’    # æå–å‰ç½®è¦æ±‚
   402â†’    prereq_match = re.search(r'## å‰ç½®è¦æ±‚\s*\n((?:- .*?\n)*)', content)
   403â†’    result["prerequisites"] = []
   404â†’    if prereq_match:
   405â†’        result["prerequisites"] = [l[2:].strip() for l in prereq_match.group(1).strip().split('\n')]
   406â†’
   407â†’    # æå– SOP é˜¶æ®µ
   408â†’    sop = []
   409â†’    phase_pattern = r'### Phase (\d+):\s*(.*?)\n(.*?)(?=### Phase|\Z)'
   410â†’    for match in re.finditer(phase_pattern, content, re.DOTALL):
   411â†’        phase_num, phase_name, phase_content = match.groups()
   412â†’        phase = {
   413â†’            "phase": int(phase_num),
   414â†’            "name": phase_name.strip(),
   415â†’            "content": phase_content.strip()
   416â†’        }
   417â†’        # æå–ç±»åž‹
   418â†’        type_match = re.search(r'\*\*ç±»åž‹\*\*:\s*(\w+)', phase_content)
   419â†’        if type_match:
   420â†’            phase["type"] = type_match.group(1)
   421â†’        sop.append(phase)
   422â†’    result["sop"] = sop
   423â†’
   424â†’    # æå–å·¥å…·åˆ—è¡¨
   425â†’    tools_match = re.search(r'\*\*ä½¿ç”¨å·¥å…·\*\*:\s*\n((?:- .*?\n)*)', content)
   426â†’    result["tools"] = []
   427â†’    if tools_match:
   428â†’        result["tools"] = [l[2:].strip() for l in tools_match.group(1).strip().split('\n')]
   429â†’
   430â†’    # çŸ¥è¯†æ£€ç´¢é…ç½®
   431â†’    result["knowledge_config"] = {}
   432â†’    result["output_config"] = {}
   433â†’
   434â†’    return result

   460â†’    if table_match:

   470â†’    result["analysis_steps"] = analysis_steps
   471â†’

   473â†’    output_match = re.search(r'## è¾“å‡ºè¦æ±‚\s*\n(.*?)(?=\n## |\Z)', content, re.DOTALL)

   476â†’    # æå–å¸¸è§é—®é¢˜

   483â†’def parse_skill_services(text: str) -> Dict[str, List[Dict[str, Any]]]:
   484â†’    """è§£æž SKILL.md ä¸­çš„æœåŠ¡ç›®å½•ï¼Œæå–å±•ç¤ºä¿¡æ¯"""
   485â†’    services = {"entry": [], "standard": [], "professional": []}
   486â†’
   487â†’    tier_map = {
   488â†’        "entry": "entry",
   489â†’        "standard": "standard",
   490â†’        "professional": "professional"
   491â†’    }
   492â†’
   493â†’    for tier_name, tier_key in tier_map.items():
   494â†’        # åŒ¹é…è¡¨æ ¼å¤´å’Œå†…å®¹
   495â†’        pattern = rf'### {tier_name.capitalize()}.*?\n\|[^\n]+\n\|[-\s|]+\n((?:\|[^\n]+\n)*)'
   496â†’        match = re.search(pattern, text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL)
   497â†’        if not match:
   498â†’            continue
   499â†’
   500â†’        table_content = match.group(1).strip()
   501â†’        if not table_content:
   502â†’            continue
   503â†’
   504â†’        for row in table_content.split('\n'):
   505â†’            cols = [c.strip() for c in row.split('|')[1:-1]]
   506â†’            if len(cols) < 7:  # è‡³å°‘éœ€è¦ 7 åˆ—ï¼ˆåœºæ™¯ã€æ–‡ä»¶ã€è§¦å‘è¯ã€è®¡è´¹ã€å±•ç¤ºåç§°ã€å›¾æ ‡ã€ç®€ä»‹ï¼‰
   507â†’                continue
   508â†’
   509â†’            service = {
   510â†’                "scenario_id": cols[1].replace('.md', '') if cols[1] else cols[0].lower().replace(' ', '_'),
   511â†’                "name": cols[4] if len(cols) > 4 and cols[4] else cols[0],
   512â†’                "icon": cols[5] if len(cols) > 5 and cols[5] else "ðŸ“Œ",
   513â†’                "description": cols[6] if len(cols) > 6 and cols[6] else "",
   514â†’                "tier": tier_key,
   515â†’                "billing": cols[3] if len(cols) > 3 else "å…è´¹",
   516â†’                "highlights": []
   517â†’            }
   518â†’
   519â†’            # è§£æžä»·å€¼ç‚¹ï¼ˆç¬¬8åˆ—ï¼Œå¦‚æžœå­˜åœ¨ï¼‰
   520â†’            if len(cols) > 7 and cols[7]:
   521â†’                service["highlights"] = [h.strip() for h in cols[7].split(',')]
   522â†’
   523â†’            services[tier_key].append(service)
   524â†’
   525â†’    return services

   711â†’    """åŠ è½½è§„åˆ™é…ç½® - v7 æ–°å¢ž
   712â†’
   713â†’    æ”¯æŒä¸¤ç§æ ¼å¼ï¼š

   716â†’
   717â†’    å®¹é”™å¤„ç†ï¼š
   718â†’    - è‡ªåŠ¨å¤„ç†å·²å¸¦ .md åŽç¼€çš„ rule_id

   720â†’    """
   721â†’    # å…ˆå°è¯•æ ‡å‡†æ ¼å¼ï¼ˆè‡ªåŠ¨æ·»åŠ  .md åŽç¼€ï¼‰
   722â†’    rule_path = SKILLS_DIR / skill_id / "rules" / f"{rule_id}.md"
   723â†’
   724â†’    if not rule_path.exists():
   725â†’        # Fallback: å°è¯•ç›´æŽ¥ä½œä¸ºè·¯å¾„ï¼ˆå¤„ç†å·²å¸¦ .md åŽç¼€çš„æƒ…å†µï¼‰
   726â†’        rule_path = SKILLS_DIR / skill_id / "rules" / rule_id
   727â†’
   728â†’        # æ‹’ç»ç›®å½•
   729â†’        if rule_path.is_dir():
   730â†’            logger.warning(f"load_rule: {rule_id} is a directory, not a rule file")
   731â†’            return None
   732â†’
   733â†’        # å¦‚æžœæ²¡æœ‰åŽç¼€ï¼Œæ·»åŠ  .md
   734â†’        if not rule_path.suffix:

   816â†’

   818â†’    ä»…æ‰«æè§„åˆ™æ ¹ç›®å½•ï¼Œå¿½ç•¥å­ç›®å½•ï¼ˆå¦‚ companion/ï¼‰ã€‚

   840â†’        except Exception:

  1310â†’def build_phase1_prompt() -> str:
  1311â†’    """æž„å»º Phase 1 System Prompt - V9 æ–°å¢ž
  1312â†’
  1313â†’    Phase 1 æä¾›ï¼š
  1314â†’    - Core Skill å…¨æ–‡ï¼ˆç²¾ç®€ç‰ˆï¼‰
  1315â†’    - å…¶ä»– Skill çš„ frontmatter åˆ—è¡¨ï¼ˆid, name, descriptionï¼‰
  1316â†’
  1317â†’    LLM åŸºäºŽæ­¤é€‰æ‹© Skill(s)ã€‚
  1318â†’    """
  1319â†’    parts = []
  1320â†’
  1321â†’    # 1. Core Skill å…¨æ–‡ï¼ˆç²¾ç®€æ–‡æœ¬ä¼˜å…ˆï¼šè‹¥è¶…è¿‡ 5000 å­—ç¬¦åˆ™æˆªæ–­ï¼‰
  1322â†’    core = get_core_skill()
  1323â†’    core_text = core.content
  1324â†’    if len(core_text) > 5000:
  1325â†’        core_text = core_text[:5000] + "\n\nâ€¦"
  1326â†’    parts.append(f"# {core.meta.name}\n\n{core_text}")
  1327â†’
  1328â†’    # 2. å¯ç”¨ Skill åˆ—è¡¨
  1329â†’    skill_metas = load_all_skill_metas()
  1330â†’    if skill_metas:
  1331â†’        parts.append("\n---\n\n## å¯ç”¨åŠŸèƒ½\n")
  1332â†’        parts.append("æ ¹æ®ç”¨æˆ·æ„å›¾ï¼Œå¯è°ƒç”¨ activate_skills æ¿€æ´»ä¸€ä¸ªæˆ–å¤šä¸ªæŠ€èƒ½ï¼š\n")
  1333â†’
  1334â†’        for skill_id, meta in sorted(skill_metas.items()):
  1335â†’            desc = meta.description.strip().replace('\n', ' ')
  1336â†’            if len(desc) > 120:

  1338â†’            line = f"- **{meta.name}** (`{skill_id}`): {desc}"
  1339â†’            if meta.tools_list:

  1341â†’                line += f"ï¼ˆå·¥å…·ï¼š{tools_text}ï¼‰"
  1342â†’            parts.append(line)
  1343â†’
  1344â†’    # 3. è¾¹ç•Œè§„åˆ™ï¼ˆæ¥è‡ª core/rules/boundary.mdï¼‰
  1345â†’    boundary = load_boundary_rules_text()
  1346â†’    if boundary:
  1347â†’        parts.append("\n---\n")
  1348â†’        parts.append(boundary)

  1350â†’    return "\n".join(parts)

  1353â†’def _extract_tools_list(skill_id: str, description: str) -> List[str]:
  1354â†’    """æå–å·¥å…·åæ¸…å•ï¼ˆä¼˜å…ˆ tools.yamlï¼Œå…¶æ¬¡ä»Ž description æ­£åˆ™è§£æžï¼‰ã€‚"""

  1360â†’            tools = []
  1361â†’            # å…¼å®¹ä¸¤ç§ç»“æž„ï¼šé¡¶å±‚ tools: [] æˆ– æŒ‰åˆ†ç»„é”® []
  1362â†’            if isinstance(data.get("tools"), list):
  1363â†’                for item in data["tools"]:
  1364â†’                    if isinstance(item, dict) and item.get("name"):
  1365â†’                        tools.append(item["name"])
  1366â†’            # éåŽ†æ‰€æœ‰ä¸€çº§åˆ†ç»„é”®
  1367â†’            for k, v in data.items():
  1368â†’                if k in {"version", "skill_id", "description", "phase1_tools"}:
  1369â†’                    continue
  1370â†’                if isinstance(v, list):

  1372â†’                        if isinstance(item, dict) and item.get("name"):
  1373â†’                            tools.append(item["name"])
  1374â†’            # åŽ»é‡ä¿æŒé¡ºåº
  1375â†’            seen = set()
  1376â†’            dedup = []

  1382â†’    except Exception as e:

  1403â†’def build_phase2_prompt(
  1404â†’    active_skills: List[str],
  1405â†’    user_context: Optional[Dict] = None,
  1406â†’    active_rule: Optional[str] = None
  1407â†’) -> str:
  1408â†’    """æž„å»º Phase 2 System Prompt - V9 æ–°å¢ž
  1409â†’
  1410â†’    Phase 2 æä¾›ï¼š
  1411â†’    - Core Skill å…¨æ–‡ï¼ˆå§‹ç»ˆå­˜åœ¨ï¼‰

  1416â†’    Args:

  1418â†’        user_context: ç”¨æˆ·ä¸Šä¸‹æ–‡
  1419â†’        active_rule: å½“å‰æ¿€æ´»çš„è§„åˆ™ ID
  1420â†’
  1421â†’    Returns:
  1422â†’        å®Œæ•´çš„ System Prompt
  1423â†’    """
  1424â†’    parts = []
  1425â†’
  1426â†’    # 1. Core Skill å…¨æ–‡
  1427â†’    core = get_core_skill()

  1429â†’
  1430â†’    # 2. å·²æ¿€æ´» Skill çš„å®Œæ•´å†…å®¹
  1431â†’    for skill_id in active_skills:

  1433â†’            continue
  1434â†’
  1435â†’        skill_full = load_skill_full(skill_id)
  1436â†’        if skill_full:
  1437â†’            parts.append(f"\n---\n\n# {skill_full.meta.name}\n\n{skill_full.content}")
  1438â†’
  1439â†’            # å¦‚æžœæœ‰æ¿€æ´»çš„è§„åˆ™ï¼ŒåŠ è½½è§„åˆ™å†…å®¹
  1440â†’            if active_rule and active_rule in skill_full.rules:
  1441â†’                rule_content = skill_full.rules[active_rule]
  1442â†’                _, rule_body = parse_frontmatter(rule_content)
  1443â†’                parts.append(f"\n## å½“å‰è§„åˆ™\n{rule_body}")
  1444â†’
  1445â†’    # 3. è¾¹ç•Œè§„åˆ™ï¼ˆæ¥è‡ª core/rules/boundary.mdï¼‰

  1450â†’    # 4. ç”¨æˆ·ä¸Šä¸‹æ–‡

  1453â†’
  1454â†’        # å‡ºç”Ÿä¿¡æ¯
  1455â†’        if user_context.get("birth_info"):
  1456â†’            birth_info = user_context['birth_info']
  1457â†’            ctx_text += f"\n### å‡ºç”Ÿä¿¡æ¯ï¼ˆå·²æ”¶é›†ï¼‰\n"
  1458â†’            ctx_text += f"{json.dumps(birth_info, ensure_ascii=False)}\n"
  1459â†’
  1460â†’        # VibeInsight
  1461â†’        vibe = user_context.get("vibe", {})
  1462â†’        if vibe.get("insight"):

  1464â†’            ctx_text += f"\n### ç”¨æˆ·ç”»åƒ\n"
  1465â†’            if insight.get("essence", {}).get("archetype", {}).get("primary"):
  1466â†’                ctx_text += f"- ä¸»è¦åŽŸåž‹: {insight['essence']['archetype']['primary']}\n"
  1467â†’
  1468â†’        # VibeTarget

  1585â†’def _build_persona_prompt(skill_id: str, user_context: Optional[Dict] = None) -> Optional[str]:

data.command: node -e "const{execSync}=require('child_process');const fs=require('fs');let d='';process.stdin.on('data',c=>d+=c);process.stdin.on('end',()=>{try{execSync('git rev-parse --git-dir',{stdio:'pipe'})}catch{console.log(d);process.exit(0)}try{const files=execSync('git diff --name-only HEAD',{encoding:'utf8',stdio:['pipe','pipe','pipe']}).split('\n').filter(f=>/\.(ts|tsx|js|jsx)$/.test(f)&&fs.existsSync(f));let hasConsole=false;for(const f of files){if(fs.readFileSync(f,'utf8').includes('console.log')){console.error('[Hook] WARNING: console.log found in '+f);hasConsole=true}}if(hasConsole)console.error('[Hook] Remove console.log statements before committing')}catch(e){}console.log(d)})"
